name: Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2
function_description: The ACE2 gene provides instructions for making a protein called angiotensin-coverting enzyme 2.  The ACE2 protein can be found on the cell membrane of a diverse range of cells in the body.
ACE2 has been identified as the primary receptor for the binding of SARS-CoV-2 virus which causes Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19).
The inhibition, or modification of ACE2 is considered one of the prominent strategies for the treatment of COVID-19.
function_citation: Patil, S.M. et al. (2022) ‘SARS-COV-2 genome sequencing and promising druggable targets’, Coronavirus Drug Discovery, pp. 3–22. doi:10.1016/b978-0-323-95578-2.00004-2.
